title: About
snippet: Hello, I’m Jiyoon.My academic objective is to study Visual perception, Attention, and Object recognition.I am also interested in using Machine learning and Deep learning models to understand human ...
content: Hello, I’m Jiyoon.My academic objective is to study Visual perception, Attention, and Object recognition.I am also interested in using Machine learning and Deep learning models to understand human cognition.Go to Research and Projects for more information.You can download my CV here.Contact me if you have any question.Thank you for visiting my homepage.Preview of my Research & ProjectsObject-based Configuration of Attentional Priority Map Images from Conference Presentation: Jeong, J. & Cho Y.S. (Feb. 2023)Feature-based Attention & Feature MapPoster from Conference Presentation: Jeong, J., Kim, S., & Cho Y.S. (Nov. 2022)Neural Correlates of Object/Feature-based AttentionImage from my EEG Experiment Data (In progress)Machine Learning & Deep Learning ModelsReport from Project: Natural Language Processing (Sentiment Analysis)Code/Graphics from Project: Machine learning (Categorical Prediction)

title: Projects
snippet: Course ProjectsNatural Language ProcessingDeveloped a cryptocurrency price prediction model through sentiment analysis of Twitter API data by implementing LSTM and BERT-GRU model. Selected as an ou...
content: Course ProjectsNatural Language ProcessingDeveloped a cryptocurrency price prediction model through sentiment analysis of Twitter API data by implementing LSTM and BERT-GRU model. Selected as an outstanding project in class. (View report)Machine LearningPerformed categorical predictions on demographic datasets with probabilistic, linear, and non-linear models, including Bayesian classifier, logistic regression, and MLP. (View code)Deep LearningImplemented CNN architectures (VGG16, 4-layered ResNet-50 model) for image classification with CIFAR-10 datasets. (View code)Attention & Response SelectionTested the effect of response modes on cognitive control via Congruency Sequence Effect (CSE) in cross-Stroop/Simon tasks.Image from Conference Presentation: Lim, A., Kim, S., Jeong, J., Lee, J.E., & Lee, Y.S. (Aug. 2020)Other ProjectsKU Academic Society of PsychologyExamined loss aversion in decision-making under risk with forced-two-choice task. Assessed individual differences.(Referenced Tom et al.(2007) for behavior experiment).
